reference.title: WS MDS Archive Service Commands for Users

partintro.para: The command is used to add a specific document to the Archive Service.
The command is used to retrieve a specific document from the Archive Service.

The command is used to retrieve a single or a set of documents from the Archive Service from a starting time period to an end time period that matches a specified XPath query, given a set of namespaces.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Adding specific documents to the MDS Archive Service

refsect1.title: Tool description
refsect1.para: mds-archive-add Allows a user to register the data from a specific document to the Archive Service. This tool is generally used to manually add information to the Archive Service so that it will be available at some later time for retrieval. This tool supports a batch mode (using the [-b] option) that will take a number of input files and store them as a compound document with a single timestamp. The [-o outputFile] option is used to specify a filename of XML output containing the list of successfully added documents, or type {http://mds.globus.org/archive/types}ArchiveDocumentListType.

refsect1.title: Command syntax
refsect1.para: The basic syntax for mds-archive-add is: mds-archive-add [options] where:

row.entry: Use anonymous authentication (requires either -m 'conv' or transport (https) security).
Add the specified files as a single batch transaction which will create a compound document with a single timestamp.
A file with server's certificate used for encryption. Used in the case of GSI Secure Message encryption.
Sets client security descriptor. Overrides all other security settings.
Lifetime of context created for GSI Secure Conversation (requires -m 'conv').
Sets authentication mechanism: 'msg' (for GSI Secure Message), or 'conv' (for GSI Secure Conversation).
Filename of output file containing the list of successfully added documents.
Sets protection level, can be 'sig' (for signature) can be 'enc' (for encryption).
Sets the certificate and key file to use as credential. Key file must not be encrypted. certificateFile keyFile.
Sets the proxy file to use as credential.
Sets authorization, can be 'self', 'host', 'hostSelf', 'none' or a string specifying the expected identity of the remote party.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Retrieving specific documents from the MDS Archive Service

refsect1.title: Tool description
refsect1.para: mds-archive-get Allows a user to retrieve XML documents from the Archive Service that had previously been stored. The input file (used by specifying [-i inputFile]) contains an XML element of the type {http://mds.globus.org/archive/types}ArchiveDocumentListType similar in form to those returned by mds-archive-add. If the [-o outputDirectory] is used, it specifies that the documents should be written to files in that directory rather than streaming to standard output. In this case, each filename will consist on the document name retrieved.

refsect1.title: Command syntax
refsect1.para: The basic syntax for mds-arhive-get is: mds-archive-get [options] where:

row.entry: Use anonymous authentication (requires either -m 'conv' or transport (https) security).
A file with server's certificate used for encryption. Used in the case of GSI Secure Message encryption.
Sets client security descriptor. Overrides all other security settings.
XML file of type {http://mds.globus.org/archive/types}ArchiveDocumentListTypecontaining archive document URIs.
Lifetime of context created for GSI Secure Conversation (requires -m 'conv').
Sets authentication mechanism: 'msg' (for GSI Secure Message), or 'conv' (for GSI Secure Conversation).
Directory location where individual document files will be written instead of writing results to standard output stream.
Sets protection level, can be 'sig' (for signature) can be 'enc' (for encryption).
Sets the certificate and key file to use as credential. Key file must not be encrypted. certificateFile keyFile.
Sets the proxy file to use as credential.
Sets authorization, can be 'self', 'host', 'hostSelf', 'none' or a string specifying the expected identity of the remote party.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Retrieving documents from the MDS Archive Service based on search constraints (including XPath)

refsect1.title: Tool description
refsect1.para: mds-archive-query Allows a user to retrieve XML documents from the Archive Service that had previously been stored based on a number of search constraints. The From and To dates are expected to be in ISO-8601 string format. The XPath expression is also required (used by specifying [-q xpath]).

refsect1.title: Command syntax
refsect1.para: The basic syntax for mds-arhive-query is: mds-archive-query [options] where:

row.entry: Use anonymous authentication (requires either -m 'conv' or transport (https) security).
A file with server's certificate used for encryption. Used in the case of GSI Secure Message encryption.
Sets client security descriptor. Overrides all other security settings.
ISO-8601 formatted date string representing a date and time at which to begin the search.
Lifetime of context created for GSI Secure Conversation (requires -m 'conv').
Sets authentication mechanism: 'msg' (for GSI Secure Message), or 'conv' (for GSI Secure Conversation).
Sets protection level, can be 'sig' (for signature) can be 'enc' (for encryption).
ISO-8601 formatted date string representing a date and time at which to end the search.
Sets the certificate and key file to use as credential. Key file must not be encrypted. certificateFile keyFile.
Sets the proxy file to use as credential.
Sets authorization, can be 'self', 'host', 'hostSelf', 'none' or a string specifying the expected identity of the remote party.
